title: Solvency
text: Solvency, in <a href="finance">finance</a> or business, is the degree to which the <a href="current%20asset">current asset</a>s of an individual or entity exceed the <a href="Current%20liability">current liabilities</a> of that individual or entity. Solvency can also be described as the ability of a corporation to meet its long-term <a href="Fixed%20cost">fixed expenses</a> and to accomplish long-term expansion and growth. This is best measured using the net liquid balance (NLB) formula. In this formula solvency is calculated by adding <a href="cash%20and%20cash%20equivalents">cash and cash equivalents</a> to short-term investments, then subtracting <a href="Promissory%20note">notes payable</a>.. There exist cryptographic schemes for both proofs of liabilities and assets, especially in the blockchain space.
